v.v: Job spoke again and said this:
“I wish that I could be as I was previously
During those years, it was as though God’s lamp shone on me
At that time I was young and strong,
Almighty God was with me during those years
My herds provided me with plenty of milk,
Whenever I went to the place where the elders gathered at the city gate,
and when the young men saw me, they stepped aside respectfully,
The leaders of the people used to stop talking,
and even the most important men became quiet
When they all heard what I told them,
because I had helped those who were poor when they cried out for help,
Those who were suffering and about to die praised me,
I always acted justly;
It was as though I myself saw for blind people
I was like a father to the poor people,
I made wicked people stop oppressing others; it was like someone who breaks the teeth of wild animals
At that time I thought, ‘Surely I will live in peace until I am very old,
I am like a tree whose roots reach down into the water
People always honor me,
When I spoke, people waited to hear what I would say;
After I finished speaking, they did not say anymore;
They waited for me to speak as they wait for rain;
When they were sad, I smiled at them to encourage them;
I was their leader, and I decided what things would be good for them to do;
“But now, men who are younger than I am make fun of me—
They were men who were old and weak;
They were very poor and hungry,
They pulled up plants in the desert and ate them;
Everyone shouted at them, “Stop, thief!”
They were forced to live in riverbeds,
In the bushes they howled like animals because they were hungry,
They were people without good sense,
Now their children sing songs to make fun of me.
They are disgusted with me, and they stay away from me,
It seems as though God had cut my bowstring and caused me to be unable to defend myself; he has humbled me,
Gangs of these people attack me and force me to run away;
They prevent me from escaping,
It is as though I were a city wall and they had broken through it,
I am very terrified;
Now I am about to die;
My bones ache during the nights,
It is as though God had grabbed my clothes
He has thrown me into the mud;
I cry out to you, God, but you do not answer me;
You act very cruelly toward me;
You allow the wind to lift me up and blow me away;
I know that you will cause me to die,
When people experience disasters,
I myself wept for people who were experiencing troubles,
However, when I expected good things to happen to me, evil things happened;
I am very distressed all the time;
I go about very discouraged;
My wailing is as sad as jackals and ostriches in the wilderness.
My skin has become dark and is peeling off,
Previously, I played joyful music on my harp and with my flute,
“I made to myself a solemn promise
If I did not do what I promised,
Previously I thought that surely it was unrighteous people who would experience calamities,
God certainly sees everything that I do,
I solemnly declare that I have never acted wickedly
I request only that God judge me fairly;
If it were true that I had turned away from walking on the right paths,
then I hope that when I plant seeds, someone else will harvest the crops and eat them,
If it is true that I have been attracted by some other man’s wife,
I hope another man will sleep with my own wife
For me to do that would be a terrible sin,
My adultery would produce in me a fire like the fire that burns people in hell,
If it is true that I have ever refused to listen to one of my male or female servants
I hope that God would stand up and declare that he will punish me;
God, who created me, certainly also created my servants;
From the time I was young I have taken care of orphans;
If I had seen people die from cold because they had no clothes,
and they were not able to become warm from clothes made from the wool of my sheep
or if it is true that I threatened to strike any orphan
For if those things were true about me, I hope that my shoulder blade would be torn out
I always feared that God would cause me to experience a great disaster if I did any of those evil things,
If it is true that I trusted in my gold,
or that I rejoiced because I had acquired many things
or that I looked at the sun when it was shining,
and I had been tempted to worship them
those things also would be sins for which the judges would say that I must be punished
It is not true that I sinned by requesting God to curse people who hated me
No one can truthfully that I did not welcome travelers to stay in my house,
Some people try to hide their sins,
and I never remained silent and refused to go outside
I wish that there was someone who would hear what I am saying!
If they did that, I would wear that scroll on my shoulder or on top of my head, in order that everyone could see it.
I would tell God everything that I have done,
If it is true that I have stolen land,
or that I have eaten the crops that grew in someone else’s fields
then I wish that thorns would grow in my fields instead of wheat,
